Package: org.ysb33r.gradle.vfs.internal

[Groovy] Class DefaultVfsURICollection

class DefaultVfsURICollection

      • Constructor Detail

        • DefaultVfsURICollection()

          Creates an empty collection

      • Method Detail

        • @java.lang.Override VfsURICollection add(VfsURI uri)

          Checks whether a specific URI is within a collection

          Returns:
          Return true is the uri is contained within the collection.
          Parameters:
          uri

        • @java.lang.Override boolean allResolved()

          Checks whether all URIs in the collection have been resolved.

          Returns:
          True is all are resolved.

        • @java.lang.Override boolean contains(VfsURI uri)

          Checks whether a specific URI is within a collection. The strings representations are compared to determine whether presence. This allows for both resolved and taged URIs to be compared. Any vfs query properties will be ignored.

          Returns:
          Return true is the uri is contained within the collection.
          Parameters:
          uri

        • @java.lang.Override VfsURICollection filter(groovy.lang.Closure filterClosure)

          Restricts the contents of this collection to those URIs which match the given criteria. The filtered collection is live, so that it reflects any changes to this collection. The given closure is passed the VfsURI as a parameter, and should return a boolean value.

          Returns:
          The filtered collection
          Parameters:
          filterClosure - The closure to use to select the contents of the filtered collection

        • @java.lang.Override VfsURICollection filter(Spec<VfsURI> filterSpec)

          Restricts the contents of this collection to those files which match the given criteria. The filtered collection is live, so that it reflects any changes to this collection.

          Returns:
          The filtered collection.
          Parameters:
          filterSpec - The criteria to use to select the contents of the filtered collection.

        • @java.lang.Override java.util.Set<VfsURI> getUris()

          Contents of collection.

          Returns:
          Contents of this collection as a resolved set.

        • @java.lang.Override boolean isEmpty()

          Check whether collection is empty

          Returns:
          Returns true if this collection is empty.

        • @java.lang.Override java.util.Iterator iterator()

          Returns an iterator over elements of type ResolvedURI.

          Returns:
          an Iterator.

        • @java.lang.Override VfsURICollection minus(VfsURICollection collection)

          Returns a collection which contains the intersection of this collection and the given collection. The returned collection is live, and tracks changes to both source collections. You can call this method in your build script using the - operator.

          Returns:
          A new collection containing the intersection.
          Parameters:
          collection - The other collection. Should not be null.

        • @java.lang.Override VfsURICollection plus(VfsURICollection collection)

          Returns a collection which contains the union of this collection and the given collection. The returned collection is live, and tracks changes to both source collections. You can call this method in your build script using the + operator.

          Returns:
          A new collection containing the union.s
          Parameters:
          collection - The other collection. Should not be null.

        • @java.lang.Override VfsURICollection resolve()

          Attempt to have all URIs resolved. Throws if there is a failure.

          Returns:
          This collection with all URIs resolved
          Throws:
          StopExecutionException if a URI cannot be resolved.

        • @java.lang.Override VfsURICollection stopExecutionIfEmpty()

          Throws a StopExecutionException if this collection is empty.

          Returns:
          Return this collection if it is not empty
